sub_title: Urban & Regional Dev. Policy | Sustainable Governance | International Development Cooperation | MPP @UNU-MERIT
summary:
Urban policy and governance professional with +5 years experience in education, research, capacity development, and coordination of international projects. I am personable, energetic, and forward-thinking. I have a natural ability to promote values and build rapport through listening and communication skills. I speak 5 languages and I enjoy engaging with colleagues and external stakeholders. I am most energised by social energy, innovation, and adventure. 

I am a friendly professional able to establish long-term and fun relationships with people of all ages and backgrounds. I believe in good collaboration and co-creation as problem-solving tools. I am highly creative, in terms of design thinking, idea development, and visualisation which I use to motivate team members to achieve personal and collective objectives.

Bio: 
Gisela is an Urban policy and governance professional experienced in the area of sustainable
development. Her expertise includes urban policy, socio-environmental risk, nature-
based solutions, and stakeholder engagement in strategic planning. Gisela has +5 years of experience in corporate finance, education, and sustainability policy.  In the past years, she has been part of the design and implementation of a variety of international development projects from nature-based solutions, and citizen engagement, to the energy transitions localising SDGs. Gisela holds a BA. in European Studies from Maastricht University and a double MSc. In Public Policy and Human Development from United Nations University – MERIT where she specialised in Multilevel Governance and Risk and Vulnerability.  


Outside professional life I can be defined as a very open-minded person who loves music. More than 20 years of experience in performing and creating music, has shown me that creativity is the basis of self-expression.

projects.title: Employability
projects.description:
Developed by the EdLab -- the UM institute for education innovation --, this project aims at making the students of Maastricht University more employable. 
Through the analysis of different aspects, different faculty coordinators and policy officers work together to develop a strategy that could benefit students from different backgrounds and cultures to strengthen their skills to become a potential candidate after they graduate.
The innovation of education and the improvement of existing UM features is a priority in order to shape a better student-oriented university.

projects.title: CORE - Maastricht University Research
projects.description:
Education and research go hand in
hand, and must be integrated within
the university context. To this end, UM
is introducing CORE: Collaborative Open
Research Education, which we believe
will enable us to better meet the needs
of society and build on the values of our
university. CORE is a logical extension
of the interdisciplinary approach that
has been at the heart of UM’s research
and educational strategy ever since our
institution was founded.

courses.name: EU Law: Institutional and Substantive Law

profile_positions.description:
Policy researcher in the Department of Urbanism, Spatial Planning and Strategy section at the Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment of TU Delft. Currently involved in two main research projects:
•  Ex-post Evaluation of EU Cohesion Policy Programme 2014-2020 (European Regional Development Fund, DG Regio) examining the implementation of instruments that support integrated territorial development. In this project, TU Delft is involved inter alia in case study research and is responsible to produce country and thematic fiches on territorial instruments presenting main findings and a "cookbook" bringing together the key lessons by providing policy recommendations and guidance documents from the research to the European Commission
•  'Democratising jUst Sustainability Transitions' (DUST). The DUST project (Horizon Europe) will develop and operationalise novel participatory instruments for proactive and strategic citizen engagement in sustainability transitions at the regional scale. It will combine design-led territorial tools with digital tools for citizen deliberation at scale. The project addresses a defining societal and democratic challenge for Europe: to hear the voices of least engaged communities, especially in structurally weak regions dependent on energy-intensive industry which will be most affected by transitions towards a more sustainable future.
profile_positions.title: Researcher | Policies for Just Sustainability Transitions & EU Territorial Instruments

company.name: Global Covenant of Mayors for Climate & Energy (GCoM)

profile_positions.company: Global Covenant of Mayors for Climate & Energy (GCoM)
profile_positions.description:
Independent Expert (DAI- Human Dynamics - Public Sector) Supporting the EU in the GCoM initiative. Taking part in the Global-Regional Coherence Technical Working Group, my role is to strengthen the impact and coherence of the Global Covenant of Mayor's initiative through increased support to and steering of the Global Secretariat.
My tasks included:
•  Organising, coordinating and facilitating monthly coordination calls with 13 Regional-National Covenants including CoM Europe, CoM East Europe, CoM Subsaharan Africa, CoM Mediterranean, GCoM Southeast Asia, GCoM South Asia, GCoM East Asia, GCoM Japan. GCoM Korea, GCoM Oceania, GCoM Latin America and the Caribbean, GCoM Americas US & Canada.
• Liaising efforts with different GCoM Partners in the development of Regional Strategies (UCLG, ICLEI, C40, etc...)
• Drafting guidelines and recommendations for the Strategic Advisory Committee (SAC) in relation to the governance and coherence of the alliance
• Principal contact point for Regional-National Coordinators, helpdesk and regional liaisons.
• Organiser of Global Regional Exchange Calls, ensuring communications between regions in relation to the development of city support.
• Manager and Coordinator of the GCoM Open House event, hosting more than 230 participants for 5 days both online and in-person (January 2023).
• Design and implementation of the Cities meet cities (Expert Exchange) Programme
• Liaising with EU Delegations on the status of the different (5 Technical Working Groups: Data, Finance, Research & Innovation, Global Regional Coherence, and Communications)
profile_positions.title: Global and Regional Coordination Expert | EU Support

profile_positions.company: ISOCARP Institute | Centre for Urban Excellence
profile_positions.description:
• Project Manager in the Horizon 2020 project +CityxChange (Positive City Exchange). Work Package Leader and part of the technical board in tasks related to communication and dissemination.
• Took part in WAVE (Erasmus+) where I worked on education, citizen engagement, and local capacity development in the field of natural landscapes, cities and water.

• Adviser and partner of the OECD for the National Urban Policy Programme (NUPP). 
• Partner and contributor to the New European Bauhaus (NEB)

• Researched in the area of Sustainable Urban Development, involved in projects with the Russian Strelka Institute, OECD and European Commission
profile_positions.title: EU and International Project Manager and Researcher
Policy Officer  DG INTPA | Sustainable Transport and Urban Development

company.name: IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies

profile_positions.company: IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies
profile_positions.description:
Researcher in the area of Strategic Urban and Planning and Policy at IHS,of Erasmus University Rotterdam.

I contributed to different projects analysing the urban socio-spatial dynamics: the distribution of wealth, services, and opportunities as well as the representation of identities and social positions in public policy and in decision-making procedures in developed and developing countries. 

My Responsibilities included:
•  Organising and coordinating team proposals in capacity development(education, advisory & research)
•  Preparing literature reviews, articles, reports, and presentations
•  Assisting in data collections and analysis of datasets
•  Supporting in the educational aspects by organising workshops, developing evaluation strategies, teaching, lecturing, and assessing Master students

Advisory/Consultancy work:
• Involved and supported the project on a GIZ project: "Ciudades Intermedias Sostenibles" in Ecuador
• Assessed a winning Refresher Course in Colombia under NUFFIC OKP regulations
• Assisted in the quantitative data analysis of a 30-month research project funded by the East Africa Research Fund (Spatial Inequality in Times of Urban Transition: Complex Land Markets in Uganda and Somaliland)

Others:
• Member of the IHS Strategy Team.
• Member of the UMD Master Restructuration and the Online e-Learning Team
• Member of Young@EUR board. A platform for young professionals at Erasmus University Rotterdam for under 36.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant, Strategic Urban Planning & Policy

profile_positions.location: Quito, Loja, Cuenca, Lago Agrio, Latacunga, Porto Viejo
profile_positions.company: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
profile_positions.description: The IHS acts as a knowledge partner in the development of a National Urban Research Agenda for Ecuador, as a part of a programme implemented by the German Development Cooperation (GIZ). IHS contributes to the programme’s component on academic involvement in research and education with the task to ensure sustainable urban development in this urbanizing country.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Project Manager (IHS)

profile_positions.description: Participated in the research development of Housing policies in Namibia. Taking into consideration the land and housing development in four main cities: Windhoek, Ondangwa, Rundu, and Walvis Bay.
profile_positions.title: Assistant to Principal Investigator (IHS)

profile_positions.description:
Spatial Inequality in Times of Urban Transition” is a research project investigating urban transition in Kampala and Arua in Uganda and Hargeisa and Berbera in Somaliland. Funded by the East Africa Research Fund (EARF) facility of the Department for International Development (DFID), the project seeks to understand the dynamics of urbanisation in East African cities on their own terms, rather than employing the perspectives of ‘western’ urban planning. The two year project is implemented in collaborations with IPE Triple Line and Development Planning Unit located in London with national experts in Uganda and Somaliland. 
My role was to support the organisation and analysis of data collection using SPSS.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant to Principal Investigator (IHS)

profile_positions.description:
I worked as an Office Manager in one of the biggest offices of Headway. Supporting more than 35 employees in their daily tasks to ensure their productivity and happiness at the office. My responsibilities were:
• To ensure that the office runs smoothly and efficiently on a daily basis, and health and safety policies are up to date and compliant
• To manage office and facilities - stationery ordering / office supplies etc.
• Monitoring and managing office running costs and invoices to approved levels.
• To Act as the primary interface and contact node with vendors (both online and offline)
• Successfully implemented new roles/policies and means for budget and financial control.
• Implementation of new procedures, forms and templates to monitor the expenses.
• Supporting finance team with invoicing, budget analysis, payments and bank reconciliation
• Maintaining office records (online and paper)
• To coordinate International travel: flight and hotel bookings, cost tracking and management of frequent flyer accounts
• Greeting and welcoming all guests and applicants, working closely with HR and IT to ensure that office facilities are set up for starters
• Supporting the International Marketing team in the international budgeting, event planning and supplies. 
• To Privy to extremely confidential and sensitive company information, ensuring confidentiality at all times
profile_positions.title: Barcelona Office Manager & Finance Analyst

profile_positions.description:
The Student Project Team (SPT) promotes the interests of all UM students. The team forms a bridge between the students and the University's organisation. We implement new projects for and by students and provide UM’s central management with the students' feedback and ideas. In other words, the SPT can be seen as a think-tank of higher education.

I worked in many projects related to high education, sustainability, development, research and employability. I was the main responsible of developing the annual budget of the SPT, organizing events and writing reports and policy proposals.

Main tasks:
• Participation, organisation of testing, and feedback sessions for the development of the new Student Portal.
• Active participation in the "Employability" project of Maastricht University in which different education policy officers and Coordinators get together to discuss possible changes on the employability policies of the university. This project is divided in 6 sub-projects. I am responsible for the sub-projects related to Internship, Alumni, and Student Orientation (Student Journey)
•Participating in the exchange of ideas about: flex locations for student organisations, applications for education,  international students' registration to UM and the provision of digital information.
• Collaborating with facility services and the UM language center.
• Collaboration with Gemeente Maastricht on the urban plans and developments of Tapijn Kazerne.
• Developing new projects for Higher Education: Main developer of "Sustainability and Development Career Fair". A fair designed for students and alumni who are interested in a career on Development (NGOs, Governmental Organizations, Policy making of social protection issues) and Sustainability in the sense of environment but also structurally speaking. 
•Encouraging other students to establish their own organization (Student Idea Competition)
profile_positions.title: Board Treasurer & Project Officer of Maastricht University's Student Project Team

volunteer_experiences.description: Part of the EU team reporting on social and regional developments of Covid19 at the EU level.

Young@EUR ('young at EUR') is a network for young employees (‹36 years old) of Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR). We strive to provide interesting events aimed at (young) professionals, personal and professional development, sharing knowledge, as well as to create a community and strengthen the contact between the numerous departments. Young@EUR is accessible to any type of EUR employee, regardless of whether you are academic of professional/support staff.

company.name: Network of Schools of Public Policy, Affairs, and Administration (NASPAA)

volunteer_experiences.description:
Make it in the Netherlands #MiitN is a project from EP- Nuffic -- The Dutch organization international education-- 
This project aims to promote long-term relationships with international students in the Netherlands. EP-Nuffic coordinates a range of initiatives aimed at:
1.	Making all international students feel welcome in the Netherlands and encourage them to start a career in the country.
2.	Having as many international students as possible working in the Netherlands 
3.	Ensuring that all international students stay connected to the Netherlands after completing of their study programme in order to create a network where future internationals can rely on.
I have been ask to perform as the main character in the MiitN-film explaining my experience in the Netherlands and sharing some tips for future international students in the Netherlands. In the film you can see me cycling which refers to the integration of a international student into Dutch society. 

video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZKMVeeURn18&feature=youtu.be
